intro: Elsholtzia griffithii, commonly known as Griffith's woodruff, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a fragrant, minty aroma. Its small, pale blue to purple flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem, blooming in late summer. Elsholtzia griffithii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
